page.title: 18BILINGUAL SCHOOLS
page.content: Teifi Valley Bilingual School. The school was set up in September 1984 as part of the reorganisation of Secondary Education in the Teifi valley. Its aim is to provide a Comprehensive Secondary education through the medium of Welsh (apart from Science subjects and maths which are taught in English) and in so doing foster and preserve the Welsh language which is a feature of the area. The buildings are those of the previous Grammar School. Pupils travel from a wide area by bus. Non-Welsh speaking pupils and Welsh learners are encouraged to attend, with additional lessons being set up to improve their Welsh. 170 pupils attend at present, the aim being to attract 500. The alternative school is at Newcastle Emlyn Comprehensive School further down the valley.
